website_summaries.verdict: The Sony BDP-S580 has built-in Wi-Fi and more streaming services than all competing Blu-ray players, but its user interface is mediocre.
pros: The Sony BDP-S580 is a faster-than-average Blu-ray player and its exterior design is one of our favorites

The BDP-S580 has built-in Wi-Fi and the best current lineup of streaming-media services, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, Hulu Plus, Vudu, Slacker, and CinemaNow, and the free iOS and Android control app can search some streaming services
cons: The BDP-S580's user interface can be tedious to navigate
And even once you load a streaming service like Netflix, Sony's custom interface displays small cover art that can be tough to read
The BDP-S580 also lacks the popular MLB.TV service, as well as onboard memory for accessing BD-Live features

customer_reviews.title: Does ALMOST everything well.
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Plays all the discs without a problem. Reliable, trouble-free operation. It also includes a reliable WiFi connection and a fair array of music and video inputs, including cameras and PCs. Its a shame Sony doesn't upgrade to a full "smartbox", and then I'd give it the 5th star, for sure. As it is, Sony provides a good selection of apps, but many have made deals with Sony and require paid subscriptions. For $50, you can get an Android "smart TV box" and get thousands of FREE apps with FREE access to every movie and TV show ever produced, as well as LIVE TV and movies still in theaters.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good picture/sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the player for three days but, the "easy setup" option was easy. The only trouble I had was setting up the wifi connection - after five tries it wouldn't connect. Sony's support line is not 24x7 so I waited until the next day. While trying to connect to support, ran through the wifi setup again and it connected immediately. Have watched one BluRay dvd, one standard dvd and listened to both Pandora and Slacker - all excellent quality. This unit replaces a "new"which failed in less than a year. Since I've always owned Sony TVs I thought I'd try the Consumer Reports top-rated Sony BluRay player. So far, I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Review from a non-techie
customer_reviews.text: I am probably an average user--not a techie but literate when it comes to technology. I received the DVD player yesterday and setup was a breeze. We had an existing wireless network and it was easy to connect the DVD player. There was a bit of running back and forth to the computer to get/input activation codes from Sony and Netflix. I played around with some of the other streaming options and they all worked well. Amazon streaming is included on the DVD player though it isn't listed in the specs above (it is advertised on the 570 but not this model for some reason). I'm happy with this purchase and would consider it an excellent gift option for family.
customer_reviews.author: Megan @ Tiny Orchard

customer_reviews.title: A good player with a lot of features
customer_reviews.text: This is my second S580 so that should give you an indication of how much I like this player. It is a breeze to setup and works with both HD and old school TVs. I bought it to both play and stream and both features work great. We play DVDs, Blu-Rays and stream both Amazon and Netflix. No problems with any of it. It is so easy to use I even took it on vacation to use in our rental condo. My only complaint about the player is that I can't get Netflix subtitles to work. It is probably user error but that is all I have to complain about. Highly recommended (although I suspect it is no longer manufactured).
customer_reviews.author: Martin Wegner

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wrong with Sony!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this player. I am a loyal fan of Sony for years and its products have never disappointed me. The video services over internet are too good. Very easy setup. The iphone app is great and helpful when typing searches or anything elaborate while using internet. To see its real performance go for special effects movies not only story/content. The Bridesmaids, Goodfellas will look alike on DVD and Bluray, but Dark Knight will show the difference between DVD and Bluray! A little noisy when changing tracks or chapters on the disc. But no big deal, all disc players are electro-mechanical and would make some kind of noise.
customer_reviews.author: YDR05

customer_reviews.title: WI-FI worthless
customer_reviews.text: dvd operates just fine, however i purchased this to watch Netflix wirelessly... and it does not work well at all After using xbox with wireless and my computer with wireless, I know that my internet and router are just fine, I ended up having to run a hard wire ethernet cable, as the wireless would consistantly freeze and buffer for no apparent reason with the built in wireless.. oh, well. Remote is difficult to use in the dark, as all buttons seem to be hard to find/locate quickly. also, remote seems to be very fussy with aiming.. odd, as I've had so much luck with other Sony Products.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bluray Player with Streaming Capability
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this bluray player for my fiance while she was at school. It was much easier to set up for her to watch Netflix on her TV than to show her how to hook her laptop up via HDMI. For internet connectivity I used hardwire ethernet. Since then, she has moved in with me and we now use it as a secondary bluray player in the bedroom. Having WiFi as a built-in option is nice since I avoided having to run an ethernet cable to the bedroom. While ethernet connectivity was flawless, on rare occasion the WiFi connection has dropped out. It doesn't occur frequently enough to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Sony!
customer_reviews.text: First I want to let all buyers know that DataVision was extremely reliabe, fast, and had the best price at the time of the order. I will continue to purchase from DataVision as long as the prices remain competetive. The S-580 has worked perfectly since arrival. I was able to make connections, including the built-in Wi-Fi within 1/2 hour of opening the box. The picture quality is Sony quality, as desired. The Wi-fi Internet has worked without lost of a single signal while contected to online video. For us this is the perfect machine, we're so pleased we will be purchasing 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: J. MATTHEWS

customer_reviews.title: Will Die and Sony Support Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last January and used it only occasionally. My S570 gets more use and I never had a problem with that one. The S580 has always been a little flaky (e.g., flashes "Good Bye" on the screen all the time). After a network update from Sony, the disc tray locked and refuses open (even after holding play and getting it to say "Unlocked"). I went through all the support options with Sony and nothing worked. They offered to "fix" it for $10 more than it cost me to buy it. Absolutely ridiculous. I'll never buy a Sony product again.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Come on 3-D
customer_reviews.text: My son's DVD player quit on him so I found this one on the Internet and not a day too soon as the price jumped up about $60. Now my son wants to get a 3-D TV set (it might be awhile, he is now a new daddy, with a new job and a new apartment and an old car). So far he loves it, as it makes the regular DVDs look better. I have a normal Sony Blu-Ray that I bought a couple of years ago and I am very happy with mine, of course, mine came with the HDMI cable and his didn't which is not very nice on Sony's part. I did order one for him. +JMJ+
customer_reviews.author: Praise The Lord, Always

customer_reviews.title: Great blu ray player but slow loading
customer_reviews.text: The blu ray player is great, and the picture is noticeably sharper than my old DVD player. Everything about it is fine, but it is quite slow initializing and also when loading a DVD. I have nothing to compare it to (this is my first blu ray) but it is so much slower than my DVD player. The WIFI feature is terrific and connects fairly fast - maybe 15 seconds or so. The unit itself is very sleek and lightweight. The remote is nice and small. I'm sure there are many features I haven't tried yet, but all and all I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: I fought this unit for 2 months. I read the reviews before purchase and modified the wi-fi internet issues as recommended by some reviewers, but nothing has helped. (Please note we have FIOS and the internet connection speed does not appear to be at issue.) Not only is the playback on wi-fi for Netflix irritating (constantly freezing or just bailing out with "WAIT" flashing on the unit), but now the Blu-Ray player is freezing. Was going to return, but my patience with the unit when it froze these past 2 months has put me past the return policy deadline date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony's UI sucks. It's very hard to maneuver around in
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to, but geez, Sony's UI sucks. It's very hard to maneuver around in. Expected more from such and old and venerated company such as Sony. But, we can see why everyone is heading to streaming media; the interfaces out there for that (Hulu, NetFlix, etc.) are beginning to stream hi-def stuff. Plus, I'm not a videophile so I can't really tell the diff when it comes to 720P streaming stuff and the HD 1080p bluray stuff. Bail.
customer_reviews.author: Booticus

customer_reviews.title: Good All Around
customer_reviews.text: Many other more thorough reviews of this blu-ray player. I like that you can navigate around in Netflix, not just watch movies on your Instant Queue (limitation of the Samsung we have). I couldn't find an obvious way to search for movies, I think I have to install something on my iPhone to do that. Coming from a Samsung, the menu system on this player to navigate through streaming services is pretty clunky. But it works just fine. I haven't tried the Netflix button on the remote, which will probably be the better way to get into Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kruckenberg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I sent my Samsung Blu Ray back as I had problems with it and wish I had just purchased the Sony first. It's just a nice piece of equipment. Easy to set up and the visual interfaces are much like Apple products, with visually attractive icons and labels. Nice features like indicating the wireless connect strength and speed (3.3 for me) when you go on-line. A little confusing to register but I had the same problem with the Samsung unit that went back. You can't go wrong with Sony and it works with Amazon Prime too.
customer_reviews.author: On the Island

customer_reviews.title: I liked it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of this model we have bought. This purchase was for a different room in the house. We are pleased with it and it's quality and have not experienced any problems with either of them. I'm not real sure of what the others are talking about regarding quality of picture but maybe I'm not real up to date with technology or something. It works well for us and for what we expect and that's what matters. I would surely recommend this player for we are satisfied with it's results.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: The Sony has been a treat. We were using my PS3 for blu-ray and games. Mama doesn't like me playing in the living room on the big TV so I wanted to move the PS3 back to my office. I am pleased to say that the S580 performs even better than did the PS3. Seems to connect and hold a wifi signal better than the PS3 did. We are watching, for the most part, uninterrupted/glitch free Netflix. Every now and again, there might be a network hiccup but it is very infrequent. I would highly recommend the S580.
customer_reviews.author: Skip, W5UTWTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned another Blu Ray player, so I don't have anything to compare this one to -- but I am very pleased with my purchase. Very easy to setup and connect to my router, after which it quickly updated its firmware effortlessly. The unit starts playing quickly, and makes it easy to watch movies on Netflix and Amazon. My only complaint: I'm no fan of multi-tap, and that's how you must type a movie name on the streaming services. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: houtex73

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Blu-Ray player at christmas of 2011 as a second player for my bedroom. This thing is fabulous! It connects to the internet so well, it streams movies like a dream, it has crackle, and I can even be on Facebook on my television! It plays music great, so I am going to upgrade the Blu-Ray in my living room that doesn't have the wi-fi feature to this player. There's no way I could find a player like this that works so well for this price, I Love Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Yummy Bush

customer_reviews.title: Own 2
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, one upstairs and one down stairs for streaming from the web, home network and from USB devices.This devce has Wi-Fi built in and works flawlessly, easy to set up and easy to navigate menu. It has 2 USB ports, one in back and in front. It also recognizes any shared media on my home network computers and router and plays it,Mpeg video, music, pictures. Very satisfied with this product, don't buy a media streaming device, get one of these and you will have a 3D player also.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I have had this blue ray player for only a week but so far it's been a great product for the cost. I had no problems with the built in wifi as it connected immediately and has stayed connected so far. I've watched videos from my computer and watched a show from Amazon Instant Video. During the Amazon Instant Video it did drop twice and I had to restart the show from the beginning both times and fast forward to the spot where it dropped. Otherwise, so far it's been a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Working Man

customer_reviews.title: First Venture into Blu-Ray.  So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased through Amazon back in February. Delivered ahead of schedule. Before purchasing I read a number of reviews of different players on Amazon and CNET. There was a lot of emphasis put on the speed at which Blu-Ray discs load. This is my first Blu-Ray player and load time seems fine. I have not timed discs but it meets my needs of inserting the disc and getting seated comfortably to watch the movie. One feature that would I would like to have which is absent on the remote is a mute button.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Noel

customer_reviews.title: Missing Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with a remote control and I had to purchase one. Would not play without one. Unhappy about that.
customer_reviews.author: FeLisa

customer_reviews.title: Parents love this thing, and not for blu-rays
customer_reviews.text: I have an early generation bluray player and it takes forever to load up. This thing is way faster at loading blurays. I bought it for my parents for Christmas when I set up a new entertainment center/surround sound system for them. They use this all the time to access their amazon prime videos app. They watch a lot of old British comedies and mysteries and amazon prime has them for free. Its very easy to use, intuitive even for slightly technical people.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Cow

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: Cable is too high, so I got this to stream movies. I pay $80 a month for cable and no movie channels and it's robbery. Anyway, the dvd player is awesome! Step by step I was able to hook up with Netflix, Amazon, Facebook, Hulu and Sony's video steaming service. Took 10 minutes to do the entire thing. A very simple straightforward machine. Netflix button right on the remote! Sweet! A bit loud when loading DVDs, but whatever. I love it and have updated software already with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: V. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Better Than TV!
customer_reviews.text: I had not owned a Blu-Ray player before and had not had access through my computer router to a whole new world of online entertainment. It is great to be able to watch Net-Flix and Amazon Prime movies and past seasons of TV series whenever there is nothing engaging on the evening TV lineup. The equipment was easy to set-up and has worked without any problems for a year. Of course, there is a later model out now.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to it's reviews
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed to be easy to set up. Had issues hooking up to Amazon website. After that was resolved, it's been working fine. Family is enjoying Amazon Prime Videos. I am having issue with my TV now. TV takes longer to turn on and tune than before we hooked up this blu-ray player. Anyone else have this issue, or is this just a coincidence? Just to update. It was my Samsung TV that had issues with bad capacitors. Once I ordered those thru Amazon, the TV issue was resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Kay

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand the fuss people have about this product. Only an idiot would have trouble navigating. Picture looks great, it loads fast enough for me. If you are extremely familiar with the playstation then you will already be extremely familiar with the interface of this blu ray player, because they are almost identical. Lots of good streaming content...Amazon instant was the big one for me. I have a 4TB Drobo connected to a 1Gb switch, blu ray is wireless, streams fine from the drobo (havent tried any HD yet). Updates are smooth, UI is simple and easy to learn, streaming content is best, movies look great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Shea

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this player
customer_reviews.text: This play is not good for playing back up copies of Blu-Ray. Sony has a malware program that senses backup copy and ruins your movie experience. Go to afterdawn.com and find one that is groovy. remember the good ol days when you could just ply anything in a dvd player? This player constantly has software up grades to fraught off pirated movies, problem is it also f's with your personal backups too.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K. Rowin

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDPS580 Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Blu-ray Player. Along with the HDMI feature it gives excellent Picture and Sound. It's weakness is in the streaming/internet feature. Streaming netflix is not good. It keeps dropping the connection. I tried the wireless connection and it wouldn't connect. I have it wired in directly to my network now but it still drops the signal to often and sometime its difficult to reconnect. I have gone back to using my Wii for Netflix. It is in the same room and uses a wireless connection and almost never drops the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Behr

customer_reviews.title: mostly easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This was mostly easy to set up, but I still can't get it to recognize my home pc on the network, which I would have liked. Had some dificulty setting up wireless, in the end I installed a signal booster and that worked (the samsung blue ray did not have this issue). I mainly got this to be able to watch Amazon video since this was a highly rated yet inexpensive machine. Other than the above, works great and I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CJH in A2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-ray player!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Blu-ray/ DVD player, my DVD's look so much better than they originally did before- without looking like they are being over processed by a cheaper model player. The built in Wi-Fi works great when using my Amazon Prime video streaming, and the player itself is so small and lightweight- I have to admit when I first took it out of the box I was skeptical because of the size and weight. But it's been a great Blu-ray player with excellent quality at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN SAMSUNG 3D BLU-RAY PLAYER (BD-E5900)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sony 3D Blu-ray DVD player in March. So far, I really like this one. The sound quality is the best! Features offered in this player are usable! Netflix runs well! Can't complain! This player can read any types of dvd/blu-ray discs. No stoppage encountered! Buy it if you can. I don't think this model is available for sale on Amazon. You can find it on other websites linked to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDP-S580
customer_reviews.text: Have not yet played a commercial blueray disc, so I cannot comment on playback ability. I use this primarily as a DLNA media player. This unit provides the necessary wireless (built-in)connection to my media server. The only think lacking is the ability to prevent access to certain media (rated PG13 and up movies). I wish there were some parental controls available. Otherwise, this is a wise buy. At just over $100 (I paid $108) this is by far the best feature-rich WiFi unit on the market for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: As good as Sony gets
customer_reviews.text: This is a great BR player but it does not ends there, If you have high speed internet connection you can watch a ton of movies. Overall a verygood player. This one has even a wifi built in so you can just connect it to your home wifi system and up and going in no time.Sony has been making BR player for sometime now and they know what people want. YOU CAN NOT GO WRONG WITH THIS PLAYER, I bought two of them one for bedroom and one for the livingroom.
customer_reviews.author: E. A.

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, I really like the built in wifi. I hooked it up to my Sony TV which uses the same software and it runs smoothly. Had the Blueray player for a month and no issues yet. My only complaint is that it is hard to input text when using Pandora, Netflix, etc. Its like using the old cell phones where you have to use the number pad on the remote. I imagine all blueray players have this issue... unless you have a really fancy remote.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: No 5.1 sound with Netflix streaming
customer_reviews.text: This player will not play streaming HD movies from Netflix in 5.1 sound. I contacted Netflix and this was confirmed. It will play 5.1 sound with Amazon VOD but for now not Netflix. They said a firmware update could correct this but that is up to Sony & Netflix to develop it. In the meantime I am deciding if I should return it and get a Panasonic which Netflix says will stream in 5.1 Other than that it works.
customer_reviews.author: L.D.A

customer_reviews.title: Blue-ray player remains dependable
customer_reviews.text: This player has been extremely dependable and user friendly. The one issue I have with it is that it is very slow. That makes it somewhat annoying but unless you have a terminal illness and can't wait the extra couple of minutes it takes to start up, you will be pleased with it; and at a decent price point. If you're an impatient watcher, spend more dollars and get a faster one.
customer_reviews.author: BMG

customer_reviews.title: This is first Blu-Ray Player!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, is all I can say how clear and nice for me DVDs and Blu-Rays Player is Great! This is my first Blu-Ray Player for me, it's works great with my Sony TV, my Sony Stereo!! I think now I only buy Blu-Ray Disc's now, because they're so clear and Great! It also works great for my wireless Router, you can do a lot on this on Websites there!! Sony Blu-Ray Player is working Great and the fan in back is very quite!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Blu-Ray player on the market
customer_reviews.text: I originally had a Samsung BD-D5300 Blu-Ray player and had nothing but problems with Pandora and Netlix. A friend suggested that I try Sony Blu-Ray for the smart tv apps. Just hooked up everything and I am so impressed! Definitely going to buy another for my bedroom. Major feature that Sony has that Samsung doesn't is Amazon Prime app. If you are in the market for a DVD Player this is the best choice by far!
customer_reviews.author: KevDiyer

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Built-In Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this product mainly because it had the built in wifi. This Sony product is very slim and attractive and it works very well. The only thing I would about it is that a strong wifi signal or service is best. If your home wifi is too slow or the blu-ray is placed far away from a wireless router the blu-ray will take a long time to boot up if at all. Overall a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first Blur-ray player, and I couldn't be happier, except of course if it were free. It plays all of my normal DVDs, including ones that I've burned myself over the years; mp3s; and music discs! It syncs up to my Sony TV nicely. It's handy being able to set my TV to shut-off on timer and having the Player shut off as well. No negative comments.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fruge

customer_reviews.title: terrific!
customer_reviews.text: I choose this BD player because it came with built in wireless networking. I did not want to run ethernet into the other room even though my computer was just one wall away. Streaming of movies such as Netflix works great!! Upscaling of DVDs is incredible. I cannot tell the difference between DVD and BD with out careful discrimination of the picture. My only issue with it is the remote is not as intuitive as many others I own. All-in-all a terrific player
customer_reviews.author: P.F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing... It's great to have pandora and netflix at my fingertips and I was pleasantly surprised by some of the other programming available for streaming too. Another bonus is that virtually any movie is available in a 'pay per view' format through the Amazon & Sony libraries. If you are going to listen to music, make sure you have some decent speakers hooked up to your TV!
customer_reviews.author: Eslieb

customer_reviews.title: Sony BDS-P580
customer_reviews.text: Load time is great on this bluray player, love it! I'm a Sony fan so the user interface wasn't something that bothered me like others say. I haven't tested out the wireless because my TV (Sony 46"NX810) has wireless and netflix built in. I was impressed by the size, really small and good looking. I would reccomend it to a friend, I actually bought one with mine to give to a friend for Christmas and they said they loved it. Lots of features on it for the techie that wants Pandora, Netflix, and other things in one device.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Probably okay
customer_reviews.text: Purchased so long ago; it probably worked for awhile before I upgraded to the latest.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: how did he know to add a hidden gem of my favorite movie in my Blu Ray? This small business guy rocks fair price excellent quality
customer_reviews.author: David Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great blu-ray DVD player with internet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blu-ray DVD player with internet connectivity. Other reviewers indicated problems with internet connection. I bought two of these and synched it with my wireless modem with no problems. The folks that had problems either didn't know what they were doing or their modems lack enough range. So far, this player has been great. I enjoy streaming Netflix. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BillyRo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: Received this blu-ray disc player promptly. I purchased it for my second LCD television which is a Panasonic Viera. I have a tendency to jump in and start hooking up electronics before reading the instruction manuals. I had no problems in this regard with this blu-ray disc player. It was so easy (i.e., 2-3 steps to set up) and I was finished with the installation. Love that it has wifi built in. I linked my netflix account and now I can watch movies. The blu-ray disc player has VUDU, Pandora, and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia H.

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Once the player loads discs, which takes a really long time compared to DVDs, the quality of the movies is good on my HDTV. I notice a slight improvement over DVDs. Navigation on this player is poor and unresponsive in my opinion. I like that I can view Netflix through it as well, but setup and navigation of that compared to my Apple TV is again terrible. Overall, I've been underwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Watch DVD's, Bluray and Streaming Video
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and operate. It has great picture quality for both normal DVDs and Bluray disks and it connects to the internet. We have ours hooked up by a cable but it can also work as wireless. Streaming speed is great although it can take a little to download - not very long but it depends on the movie we are trying to download. All in all we are very satisfied and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray! Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-Ray is great! Affordable and fast. I've had no problems whatsoever (been about 3 months). It was eay to set up (although I would register the device on a computer it will take forever to do on the device)and it cathces my wifi easily enough and I love to stream my Netflix. It is a great device and it is affordable. Plus it's a Sony and so I feel very confident in this product. I would definitely recommend this device. Also I have a Samsung TV and no problem with connecting. I don't have a 3D Tv but anxious to try out 3D movies.
customer_reviews.author: Zatarra

customer_reviews.title: Small and works well
customer_reviews.text: Unit set up quickly and worked well. Only issue was that it wanted to update the firmware. Doing it via slow hi-speed and weak wi-fi (unit is located upstairs from wireless router) aborted three times. But soon after this purchase we also increased the hi-speed and got a new modem and the update went just fine. (My wife likes the dedicated Netflix button on the remote.)
customer_reviews.author: Ankenoid

customer_reviews.title: BDP-S580 Excellent Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The Sony SDP-S580 performed exactly as advertised. Very pleased with DVD play-back quality. The Wi-Fi connected easily to my wireless network, though inputting the wireless security passcode was difficult due to awkward interface between remote control and the Sony DVD player. Otherwise very pleased with price, delivery, quality and performance of the player.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Thornock

customer_reviews.title: Sony Wi-Fi Blu-Ray

product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

3D TECHNOLOGY CHECKLIST
This product is 3D-related. To help you get a great 3D experience, use the checklist below to ensure you have everything you need. 3D viewing requires:

A Display
First, you'll need a 3D-ready display--whether it's a 3D HDTV, 3D projector, or 3D computer monitor. These displays have more processing power than standard 2D models for displaying 3D images in rapid succession. A Source
Your display may be ready for 3D playback, but you'll still need a device to read 3D content. This can be a cable box with a subscription to a 3D channel, a 3D Blu-ray Disc player, or a PlayStation 3 system. 3D Content
3D content--the actual entertainment, in other words--will be played back using the source mentioned above, whether it's a 3D broadcast from your cable provider, a 3D Blu-ray Disc, or a 3D video game. 3D Glasses
For now, the vast majority of 3D HDTVs require glasses for 3D viewing. Many use powered "active shutter" glasses, others polarized "passive" glasses. You'll need one pair per viewer, and they'll have to be compatible with your display, whether they're the same brand, or a pair of "universal" glasses designed to work across brands. HDMI Cable
To connect your source (such as a 3D Blu-ray Disc player) to your display, you'll need a high-speed HDMI cable. Cables with this designation feature bandwidth speeds up to 10.2 Gbps (gigabits per second), for carrying the 3D signal without any loss of quality. 
If you want to get more information about 3D, shop our 3D products, watch videos, or interact with other customers, we invite you to visit 3D 101, our customer center about everything 3D. INTERNET-READY DEVICES
Internet-ready devices use your broadband connection to deliver dynamic content to your television, whether it's streaming video from Netflix, new music from Pandora, or a quick glance at today's weather forecast.

Although there is overlap, each manufacturer offers a unique bundle of free or paid services, including streaming video and music, social networking apps, online photo galleries, news and financial updates, weather info, sports scores, and a variety of other smartphone-like applications.

Manufacturers continue to add new content to their offerings, keeping customers current through firmware updates, and making a bit of research a prudent step in your buying decision.

Learn more about Internet-ready devices and HDTVs, how they work, what services are offered by different manufacturers, and exactly what you'll need to get started at our Internet TV 101 customer center.






February 2011
Enjoy Full HD1080p Blu-ray Disc movies--even in 3D. Plus, connect to the Internet wirelessly out of the box, for streaming a wide variety of online entertainment, including movies, TV episodes, videos, music, and live sports from Netflix, YouTube, HuluPlus, Pandora and more with the BDP-S580 3D Blu-ray Disc player. You can also turn your iPhone, iPad or compatible Android phone into a versatile remote control with search functionality when you download the free "Media Remote" app. Add compatible Sony HomeShare network speakers for multi-room wireless audio streaming throughout your home.



ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES

Get immersed in 3D Blu-ray movies in Full HD 1080p resolution. Instantly stream a wide variety of movies, TV shows, live sports, videos and music from Netflix, YouTube, Pandora, Hulu Plus and many more. BUILT-IN WI-FI
Easily connect to the internet through your home's wireless broadband network thanks to built-in Wi-Fi. No need to purchase an adapter or other device, just fire it up, connect, and you'll have access to streaming content, DLNA content on your network, and more.

3D IN FULL HD 1080P
Feel like you've been transported into the action. A perfect complement to any home theater, the BDP-S580 is ready for the future of home entertainment. When paired with your 3D HDTV and active shutter glasses, you'll get the ultimate at-home 3D viewing experience.

Sony's 3D Blu-ray Disc players will play 3D Blu-ray movies in Full HD 1080p, plus your collection of standard Blu-ray movies. And don't forget about those DVDs: the BDP-S580 will upscale the quality of your DVDs to near HD, for a better picture on your HDTV.

STREAMING CONTENT
With the BDP-S580 Blu-ray Disc player, there's always something on. Using your home broadband internet connection, you can instantly stream a wide variety of movies, TV shows, live sports, videos and music from Netflix, YouTube, Pandora, Hulu Plus and many more. Connect to your home network with a standard Ethernet cable or via built-in Wi-Fi.

Sony's I/P Noise Reduction is also on-board, helping to improve the picture quality of Internet entertainment and enjoy crisp, clear images on your HDTV--even with compressed, streaming media.

Turn your iPhone, iPad, or compatible Android phone into a versatile remote when you download Sony's free "Media Remote" app. Access network features wirelessly right out of the box with built-in Wi-Fi. MOBILE DEVICE CONTROL
Turn your iPhone, iPad or compatible Android phone into a versatile remote when you download Sony's free "Media Remote" app. This gives you basic remote functions, a full QWERTY keyboard, plus the ability to search for information about the movies you're watching on YouTube, Wikipedia, and many BRAVIA Internet Video services. Better yet, share information with your friends via Twitter.

FASTER LOADING TIMES
Get your popcorn ready. With Quick Start/Quick Load, you will begin enjoying your entertainment faster than ever.

MOVIE INFO AT YOUR FINGERTIPS
Connect to the internet and get detailed information about the movie you're watching with Gracenote service. This easy-to-navigate service displays handy info such as cast information, genre, jacket art and more right on your TV screen. You can also access select internet apps including YouTube and Qriocity to find related entertainment.

ENJOY YOUR PHOTOS, MOVIES AND MUSIC
Hook up your digital camera, camcorder, USB flash drive, or USB-enabled MP3 player via the built-in USB input and view pictures, videos or listen to music on your TV.

UNCOMPROMISING AUDIO
Support for Dolby TrueHD and dts-HD (Master Audio and High Resolution Audio) codecs means you can get cutting-edge, high-definition sound with 7.1 channels of discrete audio, for a truly cinematic experience.

STREAM AUDIO FROM ROOM TO ROOM
Do more than play your favorite movies. Outfitted with PartyStreaming technology, you can add Sony HomeShare network speakers (SA-NS400 and SA-NS300 models, sold separately), and then pop in your favorite CD or stream music from Qriocity, Pandora, Slacker, vTuner, or NPR to any room of your home.

STREAM CONTENT FROM YOUR PC
Enjoy media files on your TV without leaving the couch. This DLNA Certified Blu-ray player lets you access videos, photos and music stored on your DLNA Certified devices using your home network. Connect to a computer, network storage drive, etc. and you'll have even more options for entertainment.
